title: Question for riot
body: With the dream of solo queue gone and the dynamic queue premade restrictions for diamonds, is this an opening for ranked 5s ladder to return?  i recently formed a team and outside of the OOL and scrims we just dont have anything to go in to get practise, nobody can take normals seriously and it just does not feel competitive at all. hope to hear from you soon

replies.body:
Hey Samuel,

Its definitely something we are investigating 

Below is a quote from our Dynamic queue roundtable.

> Weâ€™re currently considering enabling 5s for Diamond and above during specific peak hours on certain days of the week--when more players are in queue to make matches.

IMO though ranked 5's ladder has never been the optimal way to practice this game. It has always been setting up scrims (which is why the top teams have always done it).

I would highly suggest reaching out to the other OOL teams (you should know them all now after playing a few tournaments) and setting up scrims. Obviously it sounds like you are already doing that which is great, but if you want to practice more I would recommend organizing more scrims! I'm sure a lot of OOL teams would be up for it.
